CatDescriptText: Mr. Richard Allen, shipper, 7147 Hermitage Street was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 28, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the morals of the community are better than they used to be, worse or about the same? If there is any change, what do you think caused it?" answer reads: "I think that they are worse now.  And the reason is that people are so depressed, because they are out of work.  Therefore, one thing leads to another, and because of the unemployment they are doing many bad things in order to insure their well-being."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Richard Allen wearing flecked button down coat, moustache, and checked button down collared shirt, standing in front of swirled granite wall and Lutheran Church Supply Store sign, Wood Street, Downtown
